Direct message the job poster from Harnham
Rose Klaus
Rose Klaus
Managing Consultant - Machine learning & Data and Technology Specialist
Principal Machine Learning EngineerUnited States (Remote)$200,000 - $220,000 + EquityYou will be working with a very well-known, global financial services firm. They are looking to bring on a director of ML who will oversee not only their machine learning team but work directly on their ML platform and ML automation processes.TechnicalDevelop and automate ML Ops pipelines on cloud and premise, orchestrate CI/CD pipelines for multiple projects.Refactor, train, retrain, deploy, test, and monitor ML models, ensuring continuous monitoring for drift.Apply software engineering best practices to machine learning, including CI/CD and automation.Develop feature engineering, optimize model hyperparameters and evaluate model and model drift.Manage model onboarding, versioning, operations, and decommissioning workflows.Provide technical design solutions as an MLOps expert for proof of value projects.Design and build end-to-end orchestration of ML workloads, ensuring production-grade progress towards deadlines.Develop MLOps and Governance roadmap suitable across the enterprise.You will be collaborating with other data science and machine learning units internally at Takeda.BusinessAct as a trusted advisor and an internal consultant to functional stakeholders and internal Data, Digital and Technology team.Apply advanced analytical concepts to improve business outcomes.Coordinate with diverse stakeholders to define best practices for data and ML pipeline development, operationalization, and governance.Manage external ML engineers and vendors responsible for building and maintaining ML Pipeline solutions.Recommend KPIs for MLOps operations and develop tracking dashboard.Present model performance, ROI, and business impact to senior management stakeholders and executives.Oversee the development of multi-year ML/AI/ GenAI use cases roadmap cross business functions.Work with Enterprise teams to enable technologies and deliver on the roadmap.Minimum Requirements/QualificationsMinimum of 8 years of Machine Learning or Data Science experience in Life Sciences, Pharma, Biotech, or relevant regulated industry.Experience in building production-grade ML/automation pipelines from scratch (model versioning, lineage, monitoring, deployment, optimization, scalability, orchestration, continuous learning).Proficient in Python, SQL, Git, and Jenkins and in frameworks such as scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.Experience in using MLOps frameworks like Kubeflow, MLFlow, and DataRobot.Experience with DataBricks, Dataiku AWS SageMaker, Azure, and data pipeline management tools like Airflow.Minimum 3 years of experience automating ML build, train, evaluate, and deploy ML models.Minimum 3 years of experience designing and implementing cloud solutions (AWS, Azure, or GCP).Knowledge of pharma commercial Analytical Models and Domain.Self-starter with the ability to work independently.KEYWORDSData Science | Engineering | Natural Language Processing | Machine Learning | start-up | Python | Supply Chain | Software Engineering | Natural Language Understanding | Natural Language Generationms Fundamentals certification
